column4: Accessible Blockly
column5: Blockly

column3: Pre-conditions
column4: Test Description (steps)
column5: Expected Outcome

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4: 1. Click on each category
column5: Blocks should appear that can be selected

column2: Can add blocks to the scene
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Click on a category
2. Click on a block
3. Drag a block to workspace
column5: Block should appear on workspace

column2: Variable blocks can be added to the scene
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Click on variable category
2. Click on a block
3. Drag the block to workspace
column5: Block should appear on workspace

column2: Function blocks can be added to the scene
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Click on function category
2. Click on a block
3. Drag the block to workspace
column5: Block should appear on workspace
column6:
Clicking on any function block within the function
category causes the program to freeze and the console 
to throw the following error: Uncaught TypeError: 
Cannot read property 'length' of undefined

column2: Can connect blocks underneath other blocks
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
3. Blocks are currently in the workspace
column4:
1. Grab a new block
2. Connect new block underneath one of the blocks in the workspace
column5: Block should connect

column2: Can connect blocks to other blocks
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
3. Blocks are currently in the workspace that have space to add blocks
column4:
1. Grab a new block
2. Connect new block next to one of the blocks in the workspace
column5: Blocks should connect

column2: Can add blocks into value fields
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
3. Blocks are currently in the workspace that have space to add blocks inside
column4:
1. Grab a new block
2. Connect new block inside one of the blocks in the workspace
column5: Blocks should connect

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are currently in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block in workspace
2. Press delete key
column5: Block should delete

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are currently in the workspace that have drop-down menu options
column4:
1. Select a block that has a drop-down menu in workspace
2. Click on drop-down menu
3. Select new field
column5: New field should be shown in block

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are currently in the workspace that have mutator options
column4:
1. Select a block that has a mutator
2. Click on settings button
3. Drag mutator out of block
4. Add more mutators to block
column5: Block should change according to how many mutators are available.

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Grab a new block
2. Drag block to workspace
column5: Block should snap into place on the workspace and other blocks should be able to connect to it

column2: If a mutator is deleted the blocks within it aren't deleted
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Block with a mutator is currently in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block that has a mutator
2. Add a block within the mutator
3. Take items out of the mutator
column5: The block that was contained within the mutator should still be visible, just not connected to the block with the mutator anymore

column2: If an enclosing block is deleted, the blocks within it are deleted
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks that have blocks inside them are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select the outside block
2. Press delete
column5: All blocks inside the block that was deleted were deleted as well

column2: Hitting delete key does not delete blocks below it, but does delete blocks within
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks that have blocks inside them are in the workspace
3. A sequence of blocks in the same layer exists
column4:
1. Select a block that which has blocks under or below it in the same layer
2. Press delete
column5: The block that was selected is deleted in addition to blocks it contained but no other blocks are deleted.

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. A block with a block field inside it exists in the workspace
column4:
1. Select an inner field of a block
2. Drag the field and drop it into the workspace
column5: The field should be removed from the block and the field in the block should now be empty

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. A block with a text field inside it exists in the workspace
column4:
1. Select the text field in the block
2. Edit text 
3. Click outside the field
column5: The text should now be changed to the edited version

column2: Can change color input on color selectors
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. A block with a color field inside it exists in the workspace
column4:
1. Select the color field in the block
2. Change color
3. Click outside the field
column5: The color should now be changed to the edited version
column6:
Attempting to change the colour of the colour block
causes the program to freeze up and throw the 
following error: Uncaught TypeError: 
this.defaultWidgetDispose_ is not a function

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Add a new variable to the workspace
2. Change drop-down menu to "New Variable"
3. Change name of variable
3. Press Enter key
4. Add a value to variable's field
column5: Variable should be able to be selected for use elsewhere in addition to being created

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
3. A variable exists in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a variable already in the workspace
2. Change drop-down menu to "New Variable"
3. Change name of variable
3. Press Enter key
column5: Variable should be able to be selected for use elsewhere in addition to being renamed throughout all other blocks

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
3. A function exists in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a function already in the workspace
2. Change drop-down menu to "New Variable"
3. Change name of function
3. Press Enter key
column5: Variable should be able to be added from the toolbox in addition to being renamed throughout all other blocks
column6: Can't be tested without creating a function block, see test 4

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4: 1. Click Export to XML button
column5: XML should be indicative of all blocks in the workspace and should not throw errors

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4: 1. Click Export to Python button
column5: Python should be indicative of all blocks in the workspace and should not throw errors
column6: Audio block code can't be created for python so if there are audio blocks it doesn't work.

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4: 1. Click Export to Dart button
column5: Dart should be indicative of all blocks in the workspace and should not throw errors
column6: Audio block code can't be created for python so if there are audio blocks it doesn't work.

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4: 1. Click Export to PHP button
column5: PHP should be indicative of all blocks in the workspace and should not throw errors
column6: No export to PHP button on the scene, but there is a function for it

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Some block code is in XML
column4:
1. Click in text field for import area
2. Paste XML code into text field
3. Click Import from XML
column5: Blocks should be imported with their proper connections

column3: 1. Workspace is active
column4:
1. Click Hide 
2. Click Show
column5: When you click hide, the playground should disappear, show should make it reappear

column2: Can use duplicate to copy something
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Right click on the block
3. Select duplicate
column5: When you right click on block, menu should appear, after clicking duplicate the same block should appear but be not connected to anything
column6:
Block does not duplicate, program freezes, throws
error: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property  'appendChild' of null

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Right click on the block
3. Select comment
4. Write comment
5. Click on comment button to minimize comment
column5: Comment should be visible and readable the text that was entered. Comment should be able to be minimized or maximized at will

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Right click on the block
3. Select delete comment
column5: Comment should no longer exist

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Right click on the block
3. Select collapse
column5: Any blocks contained within the block are hidden

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. A collapsed block is in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block that is collapsed
2. Right click on the block
3. Select expand
column5: Any blocks contained within the block are revealed

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Right click on the block
3. Select disable
column5: The block that is disabled is essentially commented out of the blockly code

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks that are disabled are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block that is disabled
2. Right click on the block
3. Select enable
column5: The block that is enabled is added to the blockly code instead of being commented out

column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Right click on the block
3. Select help
column5: Brings you to the wikipedia page for the block concept

column2: Can drag blocks outside of screen to delete
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Drag block outside of workspace
3. Drop block
column5: Block is deleted

column3: 1. Workspace is active
column4:
1. Drag vertical scrollbar
2. Drag horizontal scrollbar
column5: Both scrollbars can move and show different parts of the workspace

column2: Can right click on empty space to collapse/expand all blocks
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Right click in workspace, not on a block
2. Select collapse
3. Right click in workspace, not on a block
4. Select expand
column5: All blocks in workspace should be successfully collapsed or expanded

column2: Can right click on blocks to show menu
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4:
1. Select a block
2. Right click on block
column5: A menu of options will be shown

column2: Can mouse over blocks to see descriptions
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
3. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Open a category in the toolbox and hold cursor over a block
2. Hold cursor over a block in the workspace
column5: Descriptions for both blocks are shown that are plain english

column2: Mousing over a block puts the selection grid around it in the menu
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Open a category in the toolbox
2. Hold mouse over a block
column5: Yellow selection will be shown to indicate block can be moved

column2: Can click on a block to select it
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks are in the workspace
column4: 1. Click on a block
column5: Block should have yellow selection

column2: Can click on comment icon to see comment
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks with comments are in the workspace
column4: 1. Click on comment icon
column5: Comment should appear and be readable

column2: Can click on settings icon to set mutator
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks with settings are in the workspace
column4:
1. Click on settings icon
2. Drag or drop blocks within mutator to determine its size
column5: The block should indicate the number of mutators within it

column2: Can export and import comments to XML
column3:
1. Workspace is active
2. Blocks with comments are in the workspace
column4:
1. Click Export to XML button
2. Alternatively, paste XML with comments into the Import
column5: The comments should be added appropriately to each block when imported and export should take care of comments and not cause errors
column6:
Exporting works, importing fails and leads to the following error: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read 
property 'appendChild' of null

column3:
1.Workspace is active
2. Toolbox is active
column4:
1. Click RTL
2. Click LTR
column5: The toolbox should be moved from the left side of the screen to the right and back to the left when this sequence is pressed

column3: 1. Workspace is active
column4: 1. Open playground
column5: Toolbox with categories should be visible

column3: None
column4: 1. Open playground
column5: Grid area where blocks can be placed as well as general interface should be visible

column3: 1. Comments Option in injection code inside of playground HTML is set to (true/false)
column4: 1. Right click a block
column5: If true, option to add comment available; if false, option to add comment not available.

column3: 1. Disable Option in injection code inside of playground HTML is set to (true/false)
column4: 1. Right click a block
column5: If true, option to disable block available; if false, option to disable block not available.

column3: 1. Collapse Option in injection code inside of playground HTML is set to (true/false)
column4: 1. Right click a block
column5: If true, option to collapse block available; if false, option to collapse block not available.
